content.en: AI-powered healthcare chatbots: Researchers have been investigating the use of AI-powered chatbots in healthcare, specifically focusing on their acceptability, target illnesses, and user engagement. These chatbots are designed to tackle a range of health issues, from nutritional and neurological disorders to mental health care and self-diagnosis. The studies also explore the ethical implications and potential benefits of using chatbots in healthcare, including personalized behavioral activation and remote health monitoring. Overall, the research suggests that chatbots have the potential to provide valuable support in various healthcare settings, including rural areas and during the COVID-19 pandemic.
content.da: AI-drevne sundheds-chatbots: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af AI-drevne chatbots inden for sundhedsområdet, med særligt fokus på deres acceptabilitet, målrettede sygdomme og brugerengagement. Disse chatbots er designet til at håndtere en række sundhedsproblemer, fra ernæringsmæssige og neurologiske lidelser til mental sundhedspleje og selvdiagnose. Studierne undersøger også de etiske implikationer og potentielle fordele ved brugen af chatbots i sundhedsområdet, herunder personlig adfærdsaktivering og fjernovervågning af sundhed. Samlet set antyder forskningen, at chatbots har potentiale til at yde værdifuld støtte i forskellige sundhedsindstillinger, herunder landdistrikter og under COVID-19-pandemien.
